chargeHist.descr: Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime

result.execSummary:
The defendant Lee A Kolkovich was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.075(1r).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

AS OF 1/27/16: AMENDED - Court grants 210 days credit.

superMiscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Maintain full time employment and/or combination of schooling.

Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
Any other terms deemed appropriate by Agent.
Comply with sex offender registration for 15 years.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

06/07/16 COURT GRANTS REQUEST TO PERMIT SUPERVISED VISITATION BETWEEN THE DEFENDANT AND MS. HAMRICK'S (SISTER OF DEFENDANT) MINOR CHILDREN.

records.addlTxt:
Ceritified Copy of order dated 9/27/17.
It is ordered that the judgment of conviction is summarily affirmed.  See Wis. Stat. Rule 809.21.
It is further ordered that Attorney Suzanne Hagopian is relieved from further representing Kolkovich in this appeal.  See Wis. Stat. Rule 809.32(3).
It is further ordered that this summary disposition order will not be published.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Lee A Kolkovich in court, in custody, with attorney Andrew Charles Ladd.   Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

Count #1:
IMPOSED SENTENCE of: 

8 YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 210 days)
  -  5 YEAR(S) OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  3 YEAR(S) OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION;

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*Maintain full time employment and/or combination of schooling.
*Any other terms deemed appropriate by agent.
*Comply with sex offender registration for 15 years. 

COURT COSTS:  $268.00 (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision);

DNA SURCHARGE/SAMPLE:  $250.00 (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision);

Defendant is not eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is not eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
From Atty Ladd dated 12/18/15 with attached character letters.
Sentencing hearing at 01-05-2016 01:30 pm
